title: ID Request: Early 20th Century fonts
content:
Hello all,

I'm trying to identify two typefaces from an admittedly poor sample. This is a signboard from a British ocean liner circa 1910-1920. The first line is a rather distinctive decorative font.

[http://typophile.com/files/fontnotice.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124318/http:/typophile.com/files/fontnotice.jpg "http://typophile.com/files/fontnotice.jpg")

Your help is greatly appreciated.

Best regards,  
 Ralph

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fontnotice.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124318/http:/typophile.com/files/fontnotice.jpg) | 44.72 KB |
author: Ralph Currell

comments.content: This is hand lettered as most signs from that era would be. Ideas for emulating the sans lettering: [Monotype Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124318/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/monotype_grotesque_by_adobe_std_bold/?sample_text=PASSENGERS%20ARE%20ALLOWED&sample_size=24), [Granby](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124318/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/granby_bold/?sample_text=PASSENGERS%20ARE%20ALLOWED&sample_size=32), [Ministry](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124318/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/device_fonts/ministry_bold/?sample_text=PASSENGERS%20ARE%20ALLOWED&sample_size=32), [P22 Underground](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415124318/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/p22/p22_underground_demi/?sample_text=PASSENGERS%20ARE%20ALLOWED&sample_size=32)

Stephen,

Thanks for the suggestions. I rather suspected it was hand drawn but was hoping I could find a fairly close typeface. You've at least given me something to start with.

Regards,  
 Ralph
